pylossmap.data¶

Module Contents¶

class pylossmap.data.BLMData(data, meta, BLM_filter='BLM[Q|B|A|T|2|E]I.*', context=None)[source]¶
find_max(self, BLM_max=None)[source]¶

Finds the max timestamp and chunk in which the max occured.

Parameters

BLM_max (list, optional) – List of BLMs, defaults to the primary blms in IR 7.

Returns

DataFrame containing a tuple: (mode, datetime).

Return type

DataFrame

iter_max(self, BLM_max=None)[source]¶

Creates an generator of ((mode, datetime), BLM_max), where mode and datetime correspond to the max value of BLM_max.

Parameters

BLM_max (list, optional) – List of BLMs, defaults to the primary blms in IR 7.

Returns

((mode, datetime), BLM_max)

Return type

generator

Examples

BLM_data = BLMData(data, meta) for idx, blms in BLM_date.iter_max():

row = BLM_data.loc[idx]

get_beam_meta(self, key, **kwargs)[source]¶

Fetched beam meta data from timber.

Parameters

  • key (str) – a key of utils.BEAM_META.

  • **kwargs – beam/plane if the requested timber variable requires it.

Returns

Fetched timber data.

Return type

DataFrame

Raises

  • KeyError – if timber variable requires additional kwargs.

  • ValueError – if key is not in utils.BEAM_META.

loss_map(self, datetime=None, row=None, context=None, background=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Creates a LossMap instance.

Parameters

  • datetime (Datetime, optional) – If provided, is used to find a desired row in the data which corresponds to datetime.

  • row (Series, optional) – Row of data for which to create the LossMap instance.

  • context (optional) – if None, will use self.context.

  • background (Series, optional) – if provided will create a LossMap instance for the background and will link it to the data’s LossMap.

  • **kwargs – passed to LossMap.__init__.

Returns

LossMap instance of the desired data.

Return type

LossMap

Raises

ValueError – If neither t nor row is provided.

save(self, file_path)[source]¶

Save the DataFrames to hdf file/keys.

Parameters

file_path (str/path) – Path to hdf file in which to save the DataFrames.

Raises

OSError – If file already exists.

plot(self, data=None, title=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Plots a waterfall plot of the data. Note, will produce multiple figures if data contains a mode index.

Parameters

  • data (DataFrame, optional) – DataFrame containing the BLM data.

  • title (str, optional) – figure title, ‘{mode}’ gets replaced with the beam mode.

  • **kwargs – passed to plotting.plot_waterfall

pylossmap.data.load(file_path, **kwargs)[source]¶

Load the data from a hdf file and create a LossMapData instance.

Parameters

file_path (str/path) – Path to hdf file from which to load the data.

Returns

LossMapData instance with the loaded data.

Return type

LossMapData

Raises

FileNotFoundError – If file does not exist.
